Title: Welcome to Kamigotchi World
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Hi there, Player! Welcome to Kamigotchi World!”
MENU: “You can call me Menu. I’ll be your guide!”
MENU: “I’ll also track your items, quests, and companions while you explore.”
MENU: “You can navigate by clicking on the map to pilot your Operator.”
MENU: “Start by exploring my options and clicking around the screen.”
MENU: “When you’ve seen the basics, we can move on.”

Title: Beginning Your Journey
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Feel like you’re getting the hang of my interface?”
MENU: “Great! Now that you’re oriented, you can start exploring your surroundings. You move around by using the Map Menu at the top left of your screen.” 
MENU: “Navigate over to the scrapyard and check it out!”
MENU: “When you check back in with me. I’ll give you a Spell Card.”

Title: Your First Kami
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Now you’re oriented and on your feet, all you need to do is make friends with a Kami yourself!”
MENU: “Have you seen the Vending Machine out in the junkyard?”
MENU: “Believe it or not, we’ve got it powered on and fully stocked!”
MENU: “Don’t worry about how, just go get yourself a Kami.”

Title: What Kami Do: Harvesting
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Kamigotchi will rest and stay healthy when being held. Being with an Operator seems to comfort them.”
MENU: “When you set a Kami down, they’ll hang out by the closest spiritual node.”
MENU: “A Kami on a node is considered to be Harvesting, but they’re not working up a sweat. It’s something that happens passively.”
MENU: “When your Kami is out in the world, they draw energy out of the environment and into themselves.”
MENU: “We call this energy $MUSU. I’ll explain more about it later.”
MENU: “You can wander around while your Kami harvest, but don’t forget where you left them! Tired Kami are vulnerable to predators.”

Title: What Kami Do: Scavenging
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “$MUSU isn’t the only thing the Kamigotchi will collect.”
MENU: “Over time, the Harvesting action generates a force that draws objects and items to the Kami.”
MENU: “It’s like a kind of magnetism that only affects certain things.”
MENU: “Which things? It’s not clear. The selection changes based on your Kami’s location. Some are simply fallen sticks and old stones, but other items are more interesting.”
MENU: “We call this action “Scavenging”.”
MENU: “Try it out and see what kind of present the Kami brings you!”

Title: What Kami Do: Liquidating
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “If your Kami isn’t enjoying Harvesting, it may not be built for such a relaxed existence.”
MENU: “Kami with a high Violence stat are more content with a life of conflict.”
MENU: “These predatory Kami can use their wild, violent natures to Liquidate other Kami in combat.”
MENU: “Unlike Harvesting, this grants a large bounty of $MUSU at one time.”
MENU: “Give it a shot if you’ve got the Kami for it. I won’t judge!”

Title: Making $MUSU
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “$MUSU is a form of energy that exists everywhere in the universe.”
MENU: “The Kamigotchi World has a particularly high concentration. $MUSU is what keeps everything here tied together like the knots in a big rope net.”
MENU: “Collect a moderate amount of $MUSU, then I’ll explain more."

Title: Supporting Local Businesses
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Go spend some $MUSU just to get the hang of it.”
MENU: “If you need directions, there’s a shop through the door a little north of the vending machine.”
MENU: “I’ve heard it trades some interesting things!”
MENU: “When you’re done shopping, I’ll give you something extra.”
Objectives: Buy something from any vendor using $MUSU

Title: Building a Reputation
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “This one is a more personal request.”
MENU: “I want to do some repairs. If you just give me the raw materials, I can fabricate the parts I need.”
MENU: “Please give me some Scrap Metal. I’d really appreciate it!”
Rewards: 6x Agency Reputation,1x “Paeon’s Field of Flowers” Spell Card

Title: Kamigotchi World and You: Having a Normal One
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Every area in the Kamigotchi World has a Type just like your Kami.”
MENU: “The “Normal” type is kind of self-explanatory.”
MENU: “If I had to really break it down…”
MENU: “Something with the Normal Type represents the essence of this realm in its purest form.”
MENU: “To get a better idea of what that means, scavenge three items in rooms with the Normal Type.”
Objectives: Make a Scavenging roll in 3 rooms of the Normal type
Rewards: 4x Agency Reputation,1x "Neith’s River of Life" Spell Card

Title: Kamigotchi World and You: That Eerie Feeling
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “The “Eerie” type comes into being when the normal state of things gets changed by something divine or supernatural.”
MENU: “To understand more about this, scavenge three items in rooms with the Eerie type."
Objectives: Make a Scavenging roll in 3 rooms of the Eerie type

Title: Kamigotchi World and You: Insects in the Miasma
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “The Insect type might make your skin crawl, but it’s not always about seeing bugs.”
MENU: “It’s the kind of thing that makes you feel dirty inside and out.”
MENU: “If you want to understand what I mean, scavenge three items in rooms with the Insect type.”
Objectives: Make a Scavenging roll in 3 rooms of the Insect type

Title: Kamigotchi World and You: Tossed in the Scrap Heap
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Like they say, one person’s trash is another person’s treasure!”
MENU: “I shouldn’t call it trash, though.”
MENU: “A Scrap Type isn’t defined as waste material that has been discarded, but as a small part of a greater whole.”
MENU: “Scavenge three items in rooms with the Scrap type and see what you find.”
Objectives: Make a Scavenging roll in 3 rooms of the Scrap type
Rewards: 4x Agency Reputation,1x "Neith’s River of Life" Spell Card

Title: Identifying Materials: Wood
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “You probably picked up a Wooden Stick or two while out scavenging with your Kami.”
MENU: “Well, here’s a rumor: These trees are all branches of one huge tree, connected by the roots!”
MENU: “That’s why all the Wooden Sticks you’ll find are pretty much the same, no matter where you pick them up.”
MENU: “Is it true? I don’t know. I could analyze the wood’s structure in detail.”
MENU: “Collect 5 Wooden Sticks for me and I’ll look into it.”

Title: Identifying Materials: Stone
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Sometimes a rock isn’t just a rock. Sometimes it really “rocks”!”
MENU: “…”
MENU: “I’m sorry.”
MENU: “What I meant to say is: The structure of these rocks doesn’t always make geological sense.”
MENU: “It’s natural for them to be a little different. The Kamigotchi World doesn’t follow the same laws as the physical world.”
MENU: “But I want to know exactly how they differ. Collect 5 Rocks so I can run some tests.”

Title: Identifying Materials: Metal
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “I’d like to do some more work on myself.”
MENU: “Get me 5 pieces of Scrap Metal, please. Just like last time.”
MENU: “And keep your fingers crossed.”

Title: Exploring Other Options
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “I didn’t get what I wanted last time, but it’s better than I thought.”
MENU: “A cross-check of all available data led me to discover this world is much bigger than it seems.”
MENU: “I’ll collect data and look for hidden paths as you move around.”
MENU: “Once I know where they are, maybe I can help open them up.”
Rewards: 2x Agency Reputation,1x "Neith’s River of Life" Spell Card

Title: Harvesting Data I
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Please hike to the deepest part of the scrapyard and check it out for me.”
MENU: “I think something is buried behind all that scrap.”
MENU: “All that strange machinery piled up in one place…”
MENU: “It might be covering up something even more interesting.”
MENU: “Harvest for at least 12 hours in the Scrap Confluence so I can run an extended analysis.”
MENU: “If I find anything, I’ll let you know.”
Objectives: Harvest for >720 minutes in Scrap Confluence
Rewards: 4x Agency Reputation,1x “Paeon’s Field of Flowers” Spell Card

Title: Harvesting Data II
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “If we want to find out how to get inside the Labs, we should look for clues.”
MENU: “Harvest for at least 12 hours at the Labs Entrance while I put my mind to this.”
MENU: “Even if we can’t brute force the doors open right away, I’m sure we can find out where the key is hiding.”
MENU: “If not, I guess we need another approach.”
Objectives: Harvest for >720 minutes at Labs Entrance
Rewards: 4x Agency Reputation,2x “Paeon’s Field of Flowers” Spell Card

Title: Harvesting Data III
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “What if there’s something behind that waterfall?”
MENU: “Go to the Hollow Path and Harvest for at least 12 hours.”
MENU: “The Temple by the Waterfall doesn’t have a Node, so that’s the closest place you can set Kami down.”
MENU: “I’ll run my tests from there. We’ll find some answers soon.”
Objectives: Harvest for >720 minutes at the Hollow Path
Rewards: 4x Agency Reputation,1x “Paeon’s Field of Flowers” Spell Card,1x “Melkarth’s Heroic Awakening” Spell Card

Title: Squaring the Circle I
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “The holes in my memory are frustrating.”
MENU: “I should know how to progress, but it’s like someone wanted me to forget.”
MENU: “Bear with me for a while, okay? I have one more thing to try.”
MENU: “A long, thorough, final search around the map, clockwise from the top.”
MENU: “We’ll find something.”
MENU: “Start at Scrap Trees and dig around. I’ll connect to your Kami and share what they learn.”
Objectives: Make 2 Scavenging rolls at Scrap Trees

Title: Squaring the Circle II
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Continue moving clockwise around the map.”
MENU: “Next up, visit Centipedes and send your Kami out to scavenge.”
MENU: “Is there something in that hole? It seems dangerous there.”
MENU: “The insects really thrive in that part of the woods. More than most places.”

Title: Squaring the Circle III
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “We haven’t gotten answers yet, but we’ve made a little progress. 
MENU: “More information helps. More context helps.”
MENU: “Even if we don’t find something with a direct connection to the labs, I feel like we’re on the right track.”
MENU: “Next, visit the Blooming Tree and make scavenging rolls.”
MENU: “The weather here is always clear. It wasn’t lightning, so what blasted that tree apart?
MENU: “It probably won’t open any doors for us, but I’m still curious.”
Objectives: Make 3 Scavenging Rolls at Blooming Tree

Title: Squaring the Circle IV
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Visit the Airplane Crash and scavenge around with your Kami.”
MENU: “I haven’t mentioned that plane until now, but that’s because I have no clue where it came from or what it’s doing here.
MENU: “I’m supposed to have pretty thorough data for this area!”
MENU: “It’s not a gap I feel an absence from, this thing is a genuine foreign body.”
MENU: “What’s the story? Who was on it? Where did they go? Could we follow them?”
Objectives: Make 3 Scavenging Rolls at Airplane Crash

Title: Squaring the Circle V
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Visit the Clearing and do a little scavenging. Do your best to not disturb the cairn.”
MENU: “Mounds of stone like this are often meant as burial mounds, so who’s buried here? Is it someone I know, or another airplane passenger?”
MENU: “With every dead end we lose another lead and pile on more junk data.”
MENU: “Let’s hope this one has something useful.”

Title: Squaring the Circle VI
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Number 6. Go to the Labs Entrance one more time and make scavenging rolls.”
MENU: “Why is that building sealed so well?”
MENU: “That really bothers me. When we get the doors open, I’m going to have so many questions ready.”
Objectives: Make 9 Scavenging Rolls at Labs Entrance

Title: A Forgotten Friend
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Let’s cut the boundary pushing. I remembered something.”
MENU: “Go to the Lost Skeleton and make scavenging rolls. Let’s give the place a thorough check.”
MENU: “That skeleton has a business laptop. That’s definitely an employee from the labs!”
MENU: “Something’s been making me overlook him until now, but I won’t miss anything this time.”
Objectives: Make 5 Scavenging Rolls at Lost Skeleton
Rewards: 6x Agency Reputation,1x Booster Pack,"KW Maps" Data Chip

Title: Deeper Understanding
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Try the Scrap Confluence for something that might be able to read a data chip.”
MENU: “There’s so much tech there, some of it is bound to work.”
MENU: “Fingers crossed you find a laptop battery.”
Objectives: Make 2 Scavenging Rolls at Scrap Confluence

Title: Computer Blues
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Try the Marketplace room for anything that might be able to read a data chip.”
MENU: “That’s the only working computer around here, I think.”
MENU: “Just go buy something and look for an SD card port while you’re doing it.”
Objectives: Use the machine to buy something in the Marketplace

Title: Humility
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “You know that strange woman here, near the entrance?”
MENU: “I’ve learned her name is Mina by following along with you. Go to her shop and ask her for help.”
MENU: “Mina is kind of scary. She’s also completely foreign to my databases, like that crashed jet. But Mina is alive.”
MENU: “And independent. And powerful!”
MENU: “She’s been giving you quests. I can read them too, you know.”
MENU: “That means she can take control over parts of my interface… It’s not nice.”
MENU: “On the other hand, this also makes it more likely that she can help.”
MENU: “What would be a nice welcoming gift for someone like that? Flowers?”
MENU: “No, I’ve got the perfect idea. When you visit on my behalf, just fold a big stack of $MUSU in the greeting card.”

Title: Pyramid Power
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “With that item from Mina, you should be able to power up that laptop.”
MENU: ”So go do it! Fire that baby up!”
MENU: ”I want to see what’s on that chip!”
Objectives: Give Soulbound Pyramid Engine,Move to Lost Skeleton

Title: Safe Hex
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “That was a mean prank on my part, but I knew you could handle it.”
MINA: ”Water can be an effective barrier for spirits.”
MINA: ”I thought, strange thing that you are, that you might make it. Alas, no luck.”
MINA: ”Lucky for you, as a goddess of all that flows, I can help out with the waterfall.”
MINA: “This kind of thing might stay beyond your reach for a while, but I can simply do it for you.”
MINA: ”Collect the proper reagents for me and I will cast a charm that will let you walk under flowing water.”
MINA: ”It’ll practically last forever.”
MINA: ”We’ll start with something that has a sticky and water-resistant nature.”
Rewards: 2x Agency Reputation,2x Elders Loyalty,1x Booster Pack

Title: Holier Than Thou
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “Next, some Holy Syrup.”
MINA: “The holy syrup will help form a barrier against the purifying effects of flowing water.”
MINA: “It also makes the potion spread more smoothly.”

Title: Taking Great Pains
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “The third ingredient I’ll need is some Black Poppy Extract.”
MINA: “This one will be a bit of a struggle, but it’s a very important aspect of the hex.”
MINA: “I’ll explain why you need the extract after you get back with it.”

Title: Steel Your Heart
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “Last, we’re going to need a large amount of Scrap Metal.”
MINA: “No, it’s not for a big container.”
MINA: “I’ll answer questions after you give me the materials.”
MINA: “Aren’t we supposed to be in a hurry?”
Rewards: 4x Agency Reputation,4x Elders Loyalty,2x Booster Pack,Permanent Hex Buff "Resist Falling Water"

Title: The Sanctuary Caves
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “’ll be scrying you while you explore. I’m not coming in myself, but I’ll be watching closely.”
MINA: “I can still send you messages through Menu when I need favors done.”
MENU: “Between you and me, Mina seems excited.” 
MENU: She doesn’t show it like I do, but when it comes to not knowing the whole story, she gets just as frustrated. 
MINA: “I just said I’d be scrying you. That means watching and listening.” 
MINA: “But yes. I’m hoping to get some of my own questions answered inside.”
MENU: “For me, it’s personal. I used to know things and someone took them away from me.”
MENU: “Not only do I want to restore my data on the caves, I wants to know who did this to me and why.”
MENU: ”Then you can have the Kami eat them, I guess.”
Objectives: Use the object "Waterfall" in "Temple by the Waterfall" to enter a new zone
Rewards: 4x Agency Reputation,4x Elders Loyalty,1x Booster Pack

Title: Into the Depths
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “It looks like Mina’s trick worked. My database access just expanded to include the new zone.”
MENU:  “I still don’t have a complete picture, but the more you explore, the more I seem to remember.”
MENU: ”The key to unlocking the labs has to be back here somewhere, wherever here is.”
MENU: “We won’t know more until we collect more data, so you know what to do.”
MENU: “Get your kami harvesting and let's see what turns up.”
Objectives: Harvest for >720 minutes at Techno Temple

Title: Feeling in the Dark
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “I was just thinking. At long last, I got you to take a shower.”
MINA: “...”
MENU: “...”
MINA: “...”
MENU: “Mina please.”
MINA: “Fine, fine, let me look around, be patient.”
MINA: “...”
MINA: “I can see where your headache came from.”
MINA: “Those magicians treated the sacred grounds of your distant forebears like free real estate.”
MENU: “I don’t know if we’re related.”
MINA: “In the unlikely chance that you do manage to open up the labs, I will have words for the scoundrels.”
MINA: “For now, let us investigate the depths of this desecration.”
MINA: “Operator, have your kami scavenge around and we’ll see what they have wrought.”
Objectives: Make 7 Scavenging Rolls at Temple Cave
Rewards: 2x Agency Reputation,2x Elders Loyalty,1x Booster Pack

Title: Where It Stems From
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “The mushrooms found in these caves are somewhat different from those found on the surface.”
MENU: “I don't have much data on them, but try scavenging some with your kami anyway, maybe they'll be useful for something."

Title: Better Than Chopping Wood?
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “Okay, you might not be able to trip off those little mushrooms, or eat them at all for that matter, but they’re still neat!”
MINA: “They’re hard and solid, like a dense wood.”
MINA: “Get a pile of stems and glue them together and you could make some lumber.”

Title: Throw Me a Bone!
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: “There has to be a logical reason for this world to be like this.”
MENU: “Even if we’ve gotta tear out all our existing notions of reality and start from scratch, there still have to be answers and we can find them.”
MENU: “A scientist wouldn't just give up on understanding the world because it threw them a curveball like pipes fossilized in Jurassic bedrock.”
MENU: “There are always answers and the scientific method can lead us to them.”
MENU: “Keep scavenging around inside the caves with your Kami, we need more data.”
MENU: “We’ve got to observe the environment so that we can orient ourselves to it.
MENU: “So get out there and do some observing!”

Title: Learning From a Master
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: “I suppose I can spare some information for you.”
MINA: “See the walls of this room? The large blocks of stone are smooth cut and fit together like the pieces of a puzzle.”
MINA: “It appears almost natural, but shows the great skill of the master craftsman.”
MINA: “You should have all the ingredients you need to practice.”
MINA: “Just grind up a bone chunk to make mortar and use it to fit your stones and bones together”
MINA: “It's a bit old fashioned, but it’s strong and long lasting.”

Title: Grand Opening
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: Hello, whoever you are. Is this how you receive your letters? Functional, though inelegant.

MINA: Are you hungry? Tired? $MUSU burning a hole in your pocket? Bring your wallet to the Tunnel of Trees and knock on the blue door. I sell treats for you and your Kami. If you need Stamina to keep moving, if your pets have gotten low on Health, or even if the poor things have fallen apart and need a Revive, my shop is open.

Title: Customer Loyalty Program
Introduction Dialogue: MINA: I want you to be a repeat customer. If you trade enough $MUSU with me, I’ll give you something special. I don’t care how you get it. Bring me more and I’ll be happy.
Rewards: 4x Elders Loyalty,1x "Neith’s River of Life" Spell Card

Title: Early Market Research - I
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: Relics and mementos from the past are brought into this world with $MUSU. People grow attached to many things; the first coin they earned, a trowel used to plant food that fed their family, a transforming robot toy that made other children jealous. Those feelings linger.

MINA: Get me five pieces of Scrap Metal. I want to perform psychometry.

Title: Early Market Research - II
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: Deep in the forest, there is a mound built over some ancient, stagnant defilement. The crawling insects thrive and grow more violent in filthy places like that. Whatever happened in the past to corrupt that place, those feelings linger.

MINA: Go harvest at the Insect Node until you get a feel for it.
Objectives: Harvest for >720 minutes in Forest: Insect Node

Title: Early Market Research - III
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: The graves across this landscape are quite old and buried under heaps of garbage, yet their $MUSU has no scent of defilement. A strange phenomenon. Are they buried saints? Were they interred as some kind of builder’s rite for a stronger spiritual foundation? I suppose this is a mystery for later.

MINA: Go get a sense of what I mean. Harvest at the graves until you understand.
Objectives: Harvest for >720 minutes on Trash-Strewn Graves
Rewards: 4x Elders Loyalty,2x “Neith’s River of Life” Spell Card

Title: Community Outreach
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: With all this garbage everywhere, I expected to see more humans. One was laying by the edge of the forest earlier, you know. It looked young, at least compared to the dusty old bodies in the local graves.

MINA: Go harvest $MUSU from its location. Maybe it will start to feel chatty.
Objectives: Harvest for >720 minutes at the Lost Skeleton During Moonside

Title: Restocking
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: I've had so many new customers these days. Help me restock my spiritual goods. The flowers of death can be made into delicious treats for Kami and other beings. Collect a few and give them to me. 

MINA: Raw materials can be broken down into ingredients for hexerei. One can craft potions, poultices, and other things if one knows the methods. I’m selling something in my shop to help you along with this: a device to break down ingredients for yourself. I won’t be doing it for you again.

Title: Offering an Apprenticeship
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: Some may view a scavenging Kami like a magpie on the hunt for treasure. The truth is the other way around; objects of sentiment are naturally drawn to the Kami. Wealth accumulates without desire, and the Kami tend to rest on their hoards like little dragons. As a companion of the Kami, you can share in these treasures and put them to better use. 

MINA: For example, you could practice alchemy, or the ancient art of Hexerei. With the right tools and a proper education, you can craft scavenged items into potions and spells. Through Hexerei you might improve your accumulation of $MUSU, which would of course allow you to give more of it to me.

MINA: For now, scavenge some basic raw materials. I’ve provided a list.
Objectives: Scavenge 1 Pine Cone,Scavenge 1 Daffodil,Scavenge 1 Sanguine Shroom,Scavenge 2 Plastic Bottles

Title: Basics of Hex - Extracts
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: Before crafting a hex, one must break down the raw materials so that they can be measured and mixed. I won’t do this for you. Have some self-respect. 

MINA: But oh! What luck! I’ve stocked my shop with Spice Grinders, and they’re just the tool you need. You might be a model student who already bought one of these. If so, you get a pat on the head. If not, you won’t get much further without it, so fork over the dough, kid.

MINA: Once you own a Spice Grinder, use it to extract some Pine Pollen from a Pine Cone. If you followed my instructions, you should already have a Pine Cone in your inventory.

Title: Basics of Hex - Potions
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: Once you have your materials refined and measured, it’s time to sit down at the cauldron and brew a hex. But maybe you don’t want to be tied down? How can a husk like me brew potions while keeping up with a jet-set lifestyle, you might ask? Just use a Portable Burner to brew on the go. Everyone’s got one. If you don’t, I’m selling them for a reasonable price. 

MINA: Once you’ve acquired both a Spice Grinder and a Portable Burner, you’ll be ready to craft a variety of basic hexerei. There are some recipes that will require different tools, but I’ll cover that if you manage to make it to advanced lessons. For now, I need to know if you’re even capable of brewing a simple potion. 

MINA: Potions let your Kami accomplish great feats; they’ll be able to harvest more efficiently, get a jump on enemies or escape their clutches, attack with more passion, or more. One of the purest feats is to grow and learn, and so one of the simplest potions is a hex to boost skill growth. Craft an XP Potion by combining Pine Pollen and a Plastic Bottle.

Title: Hex Education
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: Now that you’re equipped and accomplished, try something slightly more delicate. Grind the Daffodil that I had you collect earlier, then take a small quantity and brew it with care.

MINA: This is a simple task, so be quick about it and get back to me.

Title: Eye of the White Snake
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: Have I introduced you to my pet? His name is Ahi. It’s a nickname of someone I knew long, long ago. He’s a perfect sweetheart and very obedient, nothing like the original. That one was quite the attention-getter. For a time I was fascinated and could think of no one else. Eventually, like with most things, I got bored and moved on. He didn’t want to let go so easily and put up quite a fight.

MINA: Deep inside the forest is a splayed oak, its innards ripe with a crystalline growth. The color reminds me of his eyes. Get me a crystal from the trunk as a memento.

Title: Memorial for the Forgotten
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: The state of this graveyard is an insult to those buried here. To have graves in a place like this means something. Somewhere very special has become a dumping ground for all sorts of disorganized trash, but there seems to be no changing it now. 

MINA: Reminiscing about that lost friend has gotten me sentimental. He’s not one of the dead here, of course, even I’m not familiar with the origins of this world. Still, they deserve something. There’s far too much trash to pick up, but let’s lay down something beautiful for a change.
Objectives: Move to the Trash-Strewn Graves,Give 15 Daffodil

Title: To Whom It May Concern
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: It appears there’s more to this Menu being than I first thought. She’s intimately tied to this place, a sort of genius loci, that is not a god or a person, but some form of protective entity that exists within the spiritual fabric of the location. As much as I and my shop are connected, she is with the Kamigotchi World.

MINA: A rare error on my part. As soon as possible, I’ll send over an apology letter. I just need you to help me find the necessary materials.
Objectives: Give 2 Wooden Sticks,Give 125 Sanguineous Powder,Give 125 Resin Tincture

Title: A Matter of Import
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: Menu tells me she wants something out of the machine by the lost skeleton. I might be able to conjure a device that will help. The power of electricity is rare, but not unknown to those from my time. 

MINA: I’ll need 9999 MUSU to cover the import. You’re getting a great deal, the lowest price I can possibly get. 

MINA: P.S. She’s told me that I don’t need to sign my messages. Is that true? Are you able to discern who offered you this quest without a signature?

Title: Rejecting Fate
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: All Kamigotchi can succeed, from the Commons to the Epics. When raising a Kami, take advantage of their strengths. Build on the foundation of their initial stats. Choose skills that boost what your Kami is already best at before shoring up weaknesses.

MENU: If you would prefer to raise a different Kami entirely, the option is available. It might be the case that you love robots and want a team of Scrap Kami. Maybe you’re a dark, edgy person, so you want Kami that are inclined to maximum violence. It could even be that you’re searching for one of the rumored Legendary Kami.

MENU: If you have $ONYX, you can use the Vending Machine in the scrapyard to Reroll a Kamigotchi. After you purchase a Reroll Ticket, you can use it to return one Kami to the pool. In exchange, a new Kami will emerge to join you.

Title: Health & Safety
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: While Kami don’t see Harvesting as labor, they still get tired and lose Health. Kamigotchi hold their bodies together with spiritual energy. As they expend energy, it gets harder to maintain their form. Low Health doesn’t mean a Kami is physically hurt, but it’s still a problem you should take care of.

MENU: When your Kami gets low on Health, return to the room where you left it, then use the Harvesting Menu to pick it up. A Kami will slowly regenerate Health on its own while being held. If you can’t wait, give your Kami a snack or use a Spell Card to restore health. Kamigotchi don’t need food to live, but they can draw energy from food to bolster their spirit.

MENU: Use an item to heal a Kami and complete this quest. If you already used the Spell Card that I gave you, go buy some food or dig up a Cheeseburger.
Objectives: Use an item to heal a Kamigotchi that has been reduced below 100% Health
Rewards: 2x Agency Reputation,1x "Neith’s River of Life" Spell Card

Title: There Are Levels to This
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: Unlike humans, Kamigotchi have the potential to grow and change by using xenoplasticity, or “XP” for short. This means that they can assimilate many different things to form a new cohesive whole.

MENU: Take a look at your roster. You can see a green progress bar with a percentage indicator beneath the portrait of each Kami. When one is ready to move to the next level, the bar will be full and read 100%. Just level up a Kami and you’ll be done. Take note of your new skill point and hold onto it for the next quest.

MENU: When you complete this, I’ll give you a small reward to help encourage the process.

Title: Skill Issue
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: When you spend Skill Points to tell Kami what to focus on, you shape their personalities and temperaments. Think hard before you make a choice! You’ll only be able to respec with specific items that are difficult to acquire. This is a commitment.

MENU: Click on a Kami that leveled up and gained a skill point recently and look over the skill tree. Remember, you can’t go wrong by improving what your Kami is already good at. Take your time, but don’t forget to pick something.
Objectives: Spend a point in any Skill Tree after levelling up

Title: Spring Rites
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: I see one of your Kami got Liquidated. That sucks! Of course, that’s just a temporary condition. Usually in this world it’s possible to return to form no matter what happens. The essence of something remains unless it’s been totally erased from existence.

MENU: Take this and use it on a Kami that has been Liquidated. Just read the incantation printed on the front, and presto! This powerful spell card brings your Kami back to action. 

MENU: It’s the only freebie I’m allowed to give you. You’ll have to work for more spell cards like this one. Certain shopkeepers might sell different kinds of revival magic, but these cards are premium SSR.
Requirements: Have one of your own Kami liquidated
Rewards: 2x Agency Reputation,1x “Melkarth’s Heroic Awakening” Spell Card

Title: What’s In a Name?
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: Southeast through the old forest you can find a small shrine by a mountain waterfall. That area was cultivated for spiritual power. With the rare Holy Dust item, you can perform a ritual there to grant your Kami a name.

MENU: If you don’t have Holy Dust, a small donation of $ONYX to the shrine will suffice!

Title: Land Survey
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: Your march helped find an interesting anomaly, but I’m positive something else is hidden around here. I’ve checked and re-checked more times than you’d care to hear about. Something still doesn’t line up! It’s going to take a lot of legwork to figure this one out.

MENU: Move 500 times. I’ll be going over everything again with a fine-tooth comb. We’re bound to find something by the end.
Rewards: 2x Agency Reputation,2x “Neith’s River of Life” Spell Card

Title: Peregrination
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: They say measure twice, cut once, but that still means taking a risk. Best to measure a thousand times for the most accurate data. Sometimes the numbers might have changed.

MENU: Even if you’ve already found something interesting, please move 1000 times more. Cover every inch of this world. I’ll scan as you go. We need to be sure.
Rewards: 4x Agency Reputation,3x “Neith’s River of Life” Spell Card

Title: Tips Help The Most Right Now
Introduction Dialogue: MINA: I demand a tribute of $MUSU. You should feel privileged to be given this opportunity and expect nothing in return. Still, I’ll give you something whether you deserve it or not. No, I’ll never give a discount, but you’ll have my attention. Isn’t that even better?

Title: Hex Education II
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: I suppose I should persist through the boredom and finish the hexing lessons. You’re a fine student and have proved yourself loyal and reliable, so it shouldn’t take long to get this over with.

MINA: A slightly more complex recipe: The Grace Potion. It allows a Kami to harvest for longer periods of time by boosting its ability to endure the strain. The potion’s active ingredient is the exceedingly rare Black Poppy. Hidden in the undergrowth, it emerges from the shadows only when it wants to be found. A great degree of patience or luck is necessary when searching for it.

MINA: Of course, this flower is very potent. When crafting your hexes, I recommend that you use only a small amount.

Title: Hex Education III
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: A simple but powerful recipe, this potion is capable of undoing the many mistakes you’ve no doubt made when raising your Kami. The key ingredient is Mint. While common elsewhere, it grows in only a few places in this world and rarely spreads.

MINA: Find one Mint and grind it up, you’ll need every single shred for one potion. It’s an elusive reagent, so be patient while you’re on the hunt. Hexers of the past would obsess over the search for rare ingredients and fall to madness for things like this. However, you’ve always seemed unusually dry, so perhaps you’ll handle the stress with ease.

Title: Customer Loyalty Program II
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: On the wall in my shop hangs a board tracking my favorite customers. That could be you one day at the top among the angels.

MINA: You won’t get better prices anywhere else, so start spending.

Title: Going Out For a Coffee
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: I came across this beverage long ago when I met the peoples of Lake Shala, who offered this drink to the gods as appeasement. I was quite taken by its taste, though I can’t recall when I last had it. We don’t have access to the original ingredients here, but I believe materials are available to craft an approximation of the flavor. 

MINA: Start by crafting a proper receptacle: Chisel a chunk of Stone with a Screwdriver to make an Empty Cup. You might think it possible to drink this potion from a plastic bottle or a glass jar, but it isn’t. Only a proper stone cup will do. For the approximate materials, seek out a Sanguine Shroom for the color and body, and a Pine Cone for the dry finish and spicy floral aroma. It may sound unpleasant, but wait until it’s been brewed before you judge.

Title: Teatime
Introduction Dialogue:
MINA: I just gave you a lesson to craft a useful potion with Mint, I know, but could you put that aside for a moment? With the mint on my mind, I’d like a cup of tea. 

MINA: I deserve a break after all this work, you must agree.

Title: The Wages of Sin
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: I noticed some strange coins in your inventory. The design is a little like an ancient Greek obol, but there’s something off about the metal, it’s too pure for the era. And the way they catch the light and glitter despite being so dull, it’s not right. 

MENU: Give me a handful to take a closer look at. I’ll run a battery of tests.

Title: Go Suck An Egg
Introduction Dialogue:
MENU: I know there’s a window on me somewhere, a secret shop where you can use those Obols to buy something. Don’t tell me it’s not real, I can tell it’s there. They refuse to sell to me, so you’re gonna have to shell out just this once. 

MENU: I want you to buy what they’re selling and give it to Mina. She’ll probably be able to tell us something about it.
Objectives: Move to Convenience Store,Give 1 Wonder Egg
Rewards: 2x Agency Reputation,2x Elders Loyalty,1x Booster Pack

Title: Claim Your Free Gift!
Introduction Dialogue: I was really going through it on the 21st. It had me feeling bad enough that it must have affected you too. Here, take this.
Rewards: 5x Booster Pack,3x "Melkarth's Heroic Awakening" Spell Card

Title: Daily Test Quest
Introduction Dialogue: Beg for your MUSU.

Title: Crafting Materials
Introduction Dialogue: Let there be Craft
Rewards: 100x Stone,100x Stick,50x Plastic Bottle,10x Glass Jar,100x Pine Cones,100x Burgers

Title: Lottery Loving
Introduction Dialogue: Stop being Kamiless

Title: Crafting Materials II
Introduction Dialogue: More crafting materials
Rewards: 100x Chalkberry,100x Shroom,100x Resin,100x Holy Dust,100x Scrap Metals

Title: Crafting Toolkit
Introduction Dialogue: You need equipment to make new items.
